poem:
**Mushroom Aisle**

Next to the soda, a new alchemy,  
lion's mane mingles with reishi,  
a shot to lift the morning fog  
or cradle the evening in soft arms.  
In a supermarket's quiet aisle,  
mushrooms work their quiet magic,  
while carts rattle past unfazed,  
as if seeking the next meal,  
tethered by aisles, sorcery unseen.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Mushroom magic? M&S introduces ‘shots’ said to bring you up – or down First they gave us the meal deal. Now they’re trying to help boost our brains. Marks & Spencer’s new range of drinks containing adaptogenic mushrooms make it the first major supermarket to sell “functional juices”. From this year, you can now find “lion’s mane latte” and “reishi shots” next to Lucozade and lemonade on the soft drinks shelf. Distilled into little shots". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
